I'm getting this too, but only if I never used the snap tool before following your steps. No crash for any of the following:

#A#

1. Insert a shape in the main window

2. Turn on the snap tool and select a triangle on the shape

3. Select the arrow mode (cancel/reset snapping) 

4. Enter model editor and follow your steps, no crash


#B#

1. Insert 2 shapes in the main window

2. Turn on the snap tool and snap one shape the other

3. Enter model editor and follow your steps, no crash

#C#

1. Enter model editor, insert 2 shapes

2. Turn on the snap tool and select a triangle on the shape

3. Select the arrow mode (cancel/reset snapping) 

4. Follow your steps but make sure you use the other shape, no crash. (Crashes if you try using the same shape as before)

#D#

1. Enter model editor, insert 2 shapes

2. Turn on the snap tool and snap one shape the other

3. Follow your steps with either shape, no crash.

The only thing I noticed is that `ModelSnap::Reset` is called whenever you complete snapping or change mode, but I still don't know where to go from there...
